patients.name: Francisco Dias de Araujo
patients.currentResidence: Mexico City, Bica de Duarte Bello
patients.actualDiagnosis: Severe gastrointestinal infection with systemic complications
patients.contemporaryTheory: Malignant fever caused by corrupted humors, exacerbated by a venereal taint
possibleTreatments: Mercury preparations to address venereal taint
patients.socialContext: His prolonged illness has caused significant disruption to his business affairs and local textile trade

patients.name: Visconde Pedro Jaques de Magalhaens
patients.contemporaryTheory: Colic caused by an imbalance of cold and hot humors, with possible obstruction of the biliary passages
patients.socialContext: His sudden illness has caused concern among colonial officials and military leadership

patients.name: Padre Fr. Paulo da Silva
patients.currentResidence: Mexico City, Carmelite Monastery in San Ángel
patients.contemporaryTheory: Nephritick colic caused by stones or gravel in the kidneys, with associated vapors affecting the heart and extremities
possibleTreatments: Warm baths to relax the passages
Application of leeches to the affected areas
Cordial preparations to strengthen the heart
patients.socialContext: His illness has disrupted the monastery's daily routines and caused concern among the religious community

patients.name: Xochitl
patients.currentResidence: Mexico City, Barrio de San Juan
patients.contemporaryTheory: Imbalance of humors in the lower belly, possibly caused by miasmas from contaminated water
possibleTreatments: Decoctions of local herbs to cool the bowels
patients.socialContext: Her illness has left her unable to work, affecting her family's livelihood

patients.name: Isabella Rodriguez
symptoms: Excessive itching all over the body
patients.contemporaryTheory: Imbalance of humors due to melancholic temperament and excessive penitence
patients.socialContext: A devout widow who has dedicated herself to religious pursuits, causing concern among her family about her health

patients.name: Fray Esteban
patients.actualDiagnosis: Severe hemorrhoids leading to anemia and edema
patients.contemporaryTheory: Excessive heat and thinness of blood causing continuous hemorrhoidal flux, leading to weakness of the sanguifying faculty and accumulation of serous humors
possibleTreatments: Purging with mirobalans and rhubarb to remove sharp humors
Cordial made with tormentil root and plantain to strengthen and cool the blood
Induced vomiting to divert humors from the lower parts
Powder made of red coral, dragon's blood, and knotgrass to thicken the blood
Application of cool, astringent herbs like houseleek to the liver region and feet
patients.socialContext: His illness has prevented him from performing his religious duties, causing concern in the Dominican community

patients.name: Isabel de la Cruz
patients.contemporaryTheory: Excess of black bile affecting the brain and nervous system, exacerbated by exposure to strong odors and loud noises
possibleTreatments: Application of poultices made from willow bark
patients.socialContext: Her condition has caused strain in her household, as she is often unable to perform her domestic duties

patients.name: Don Alejandro Cortez
symptoms: Severe gout attacks in the feet and hands
patients.contemporaryTheory: Excess of uric acid (referred to as a cold, wet humor) in the blood, causing the formation of painful crystals in the joints
possibleTreatments: Cupping and leeches to the affected joints
Dietary restrictions to avoid rich foods
Infusions of nettle and juniper berries
patients.socialContext: His gout has rendered him immobile, affecting his ability to engage in social and religious activities, leading to a decline in his social standing

patients.name: Ana María de Soto
patients.contemporaryTheory: Imbalance of humors in the lungs, possibly aggravated by poor air quality and malnutrition
possibleTreatments: Herbal decoctions to strengthen the lungs
Rest in a clean, dry environment
Dietary improvements with fresh milk and eggs
patients.socialContext: Her illness has caused fear among her coworkers, leading to social isolation and financial hardship due to her inability to work

patients.name: Carlos Enriquez
patients.currentResidence: Mexico City, near the Royal Palace
patients.contemporaryTheory: Weakness of the heart muscle due to imbalanced humors, leading to accumulation of fluids in the lungs and extremities
possibleTreatments: Diuretic herbs like dandelion and juniper
Strengthening decoctions with hawthorn and motherwort
patients.socialContext: His declining health has caused concern among his clients and colleagues, affecting his legal practice and social standing

patients.name: Rosa Maria Perez
patients.contemporaryTheory: Weakness of the blood due to poor diet and chronic blood loss, possibly exacerbated by heavy menstruation
possibleTreatments: Iron-rich herbal decoctions with nettle and yellow dock
Dietary improvements with red meat and dark leafy greens
Rest and avoidance of strenuous activities
Application of leeches to reduce excess humors
patients.socialContext: Her condition has made it difficult for her to care for her children and manage household duties, causing strain on her family

patients.name: Don Manuel Sanchez
patients.contemporaryTheory: Obstruction of the spinal channels by cold, phlegmatic humors, leading to compression of the nerves and loss of function
possibleTreatments: Cupping and leeches along the spine
Hot compresses to the lower back
patients.socialContext: His condition has significantly impacted his mobility, making it difficult for him to manage his business and attend social functions

patients.name: María Dolores Herrera
patients.contemporaryTheory: Imbalance of humors in the lungs, possibly aggravated by exposure to cold, damp conditions
possibleTreatments: Herbal infusions with thyme and eucalyptus
Warm poultices applied to the chest
Dietary adjustments to avoid phlegm-producing foods
Rest in a warm, dry environment
patients.socialContext: Her illness has affected her ability to work, leading to financial difficulties and reliance on charity

patients.name: José Ignacio Ruiz
patients.currentResidence: Mexico City, Plaza de Santo Domingo
patients.contemporaryTheory: Weakness of the brain due to depletion of vital spirits, possibly aggravated by melancholic temperament
possibleTreatments: Herbal decoctions with sage and rosemary to strengthen the brain
Dietary adjustments to include more fresh fruits and vegetables
Regular mental exercises to stimulate the brain
Avoidance of stress and emotional disturbances
patients.socialContext: His declining mental state has caused concern among his family and former students, leading to social isolation

patients.name: Antonia Garcia
patients.contemporaryTheory: Imbalance of humors in the stomach and intestines, possibly caused by consumption of spoiled food or contaminated water
possibleTreatments: Herbal decoctions with ginger and peppermint
Dietary adjustments to avoid rich, greasy foods
Rest and hydration with clear broths
Application of warm compresses to the abdomen
patients.socialContext: Her illness has prevented her from working, leading to financial difficulties and reliance on her employer's charity

patients.name: Diego Martinez
symptoms: Swelling in the hands and knees
patients.contemporaryTheory: Excess of cold, wet humors in the joints, leading to chronic inflammation and deformity
possibleTreatments: Herbal poultices with comfrey and arnica
Gentle exercise to maintain joint mobility
patients.socialContext: His condition has significantly impacted his ability to work, leading to financial strain and reliance on his family

patients.name: Catalina de los Santos
patients.currentResidence: Mexico City, near the Royal Palace
patients.contemporaryTheory: Imbalance of humors in the brain, possibly caused by excessive heat or stress
possibleTreatments: Herbal infusions with feverfew and peppermint
Rest in a dark, quiet room
Application of cold compresses to the forehead
patients.socialContext: Her condition has caused concern among her family and friends, as it has significantly impacted her ability to participate in social activities

patients.name: Juan Carlos Mendoza
patients.contemporaryTheory: Weakness of the heart due to depletion of vital spirits, possibly caused by stress or emotional distress
possibleTreatments: Herbal infusions with hawthorn and motherwort
Dietary adjustments to include more fresh fruits and vegetables
patients.socialContext: His condition has caused concern among his colleagues and subordinates, leading to a temporary leave of absence from his duties

patients.currentResidence: Mexico City, Barrio de San Juan
patients.contemporaryTheory: Obstruction of the spinal channels by cold, phlegmatic humors, leading to compression of the nerves and loss of function
possibleTreatments: Cupping and leeches along the spine
Hot compresses to the lower back
patients.socialContext: His condition has significantly impacted his ability to work, leading to financial strain and reliance on his family

patients.name: Don Luis de Alvarado
symptoms: Swelling in the hands and knees
patients.contemporaryTheory: Excess of cold, wet humors in the joints, leading to chronic inflammation and deformity
possibleTreatments: Herbal poultices with comfrey and arnica
Gentle exercise to maintain joint mobility
